intro: Reineckea incurva, commonly known as the curly reineckea, is a striking evergreen shrub native to the coastal regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its dense, dark green foliage and unique, curling leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces small, white, fragrant flowers during the summer months, which are followed by blue-black berries. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and hardy nature, it is a popular choice for coastal gardens and rockeries.
